intro: Troschelia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco troschelia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetland habitats and is adapted to thrive in moist, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
